intro: Chrysanthemum leucanthemum var. crassifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf oxeye daisy, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its white to pale yellow flower heads surrounded by broad, dark green basal leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white petals. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
